content: k1 repeat from * to end sometimes have to knit 2 sts in a row on the 1st and 3rd dpns rnds 6 8 with a knit round 9 with b * k1 slip 1 wyif repeat from * to end starting with round 2 of woven stripe pattern shape gusset as rnds 10 12 with b knit follows rnds 13 14 with c repeat rnds 3 4 round 1 1st dpn work in pattern to last 2 sts k2tog rnds 15 18 with b repeat rnds 5 8 2nd dpn work in pattern 3rd dpn ssk work in pattern rnds 19 22 with c repeat rnds 9 12 round 2 work in pattern rnds 23 24 with a repeat rnds 3 4 repeat rnds 1 and 2 until 72 sts remain rnds 25 28 with c repeat rnds 5 8 rnds 29 30 with a repeat rnds 9 10 foot repeat rnds 1 30 for pattern continue even in stitch pattern until woven stripe pattern has been worked 3 times from gusset and then work rnds 1-8 once socks more foot should measure approximately 7¼ leg break b and c and work toe with a with a cast on 72 sts and divide so that there are 18 sts on 1st dpn 36 sts on 2nd dpn and 18 sts on 3rd dpn join for working in note to lengthen or shorten the foot length work in woven stripe the round being careful not to twist work in k2 p2 rib for 1½ pattern until foot measures 1¾ less than desired length ending after a knit round with a begin woven stripe pattern and work rnds 1 30 twice break b and c and work heel flap with a cranberry biscotti by elizabeth sullivan ~ 1 ~ www sweetpaprikadesigns com toe wyif with yarn in front round 1 1st dpn k to last 2 sts k2tog 2nd dpn ssk cranberry chocolate biscotti k to last 2 sts k2tog 3rd dpn ssk k to end round 2 knit makes about 24 biscotti repeat rnds 1 and 2 until 28 sts remain knit 7 sts from 1st dpn onto 3rd dpn graft toe using kitchener stitch 2¼ 2½ cups all-purpose flour ½ cup cornmeal finishing 1½ tsp baking powder weave in all ends ½ tsp salt ½ cup chocolate chips special techniques ¼ cup oil kitchener stitch 1 cup brown sugar break yarn leaving a long tail and thread tail onto yarn needle ½ cup milk or soymilk holding both dpns in the left hand with one behind the other 1 cup fresh cranberries coarsely chopped graft the stitches together as or follows insert the yarn needle through the first st on the front ½ cup dried cranberries coarsely chopped dpn as if to purl then through the first st on the back dpn as if to knit preheat oven to 350°f 180°c lightly oil a baking sheet * insert the yarn needle through the first front st as
